clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used in patients over 12 years old for the treatment of partial onset seizures that may or may not occur with generalized seizures

contraindications.disease: The FDA label includes an important warning of serious or life threatening behavioral and psychiatric adverse reactions including aggression hostility irritability anger and homicidal thoughts in patients taking perampanel
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Perampanel is involved in inhibiting neuronal excitation in the central nervous system leading to such effects as decreased pyschomotor performance

incompatibilities.description: The serum concentration of Perampanel can be increased when it is combined with Peginterferon alfa 2b
The serum concentration of Perampanel can be decreased when it is combined with Leflunomide
The serum concentration of Perampanel can be decreased when it is combined with Teriflunomide
